page.title: 04THE COMMON,BADDESLEY ENSOR
page.content: Baddesley Common covers about 75 acres.It stretches from North to South along the Eastern boundary of the village.Many paths lead across the common to various places in the village.The vegetation is mostly rough grassland and heather with Birch,Oak and Hawthorn trees.The common has been there for as long as anyone can remember.Some people use the common to graze horses and goats.Children play on the open spaces and some people ride motor bikes over it.The common is owned by the "Lords of the Manor" but the Parish Council are hoping that the Warwickshire Nature Conservation Trust will take over the management of the land in order to protect the interesting wild life that is to be found there.Baddesley folk are very proud of their common and are determined to keep it for the future.
